contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=April 2007}} [[File:Crookedisland.png|right|thumb|270px|Location of Kat O in Hong Kong.]] [[File:Kat O.jpg|right|thumb|270px|The pier of Kat O]] [[File:Tin Hau Temple Kat O.jpg|right|thumb|270px|[[Tin Hau temples in Hong Kong|Tin Hau Temple]] on Kat O]] '''Kat O''' ({{zh|t=吉澳}}，[[Hakka Chinese|Hakka]]: ket au) or '''Crooked Island''' is an [[island]] of [[Hong Kong]] located in the north-east of the territory. Administratively, it is part of [[North District, Hong Kong|North District]]. [[File:Kat O Marine Police station.jpg|right|thumb|180px|Hong Kong Marine Police station on Kat O]] ==Geography== Kat O has an area of 2.35 km².<ref>[http://www.landsd.gov.hk/mapping/text/news/map.htm landsd.gov.hk]</ref> It is the largest island in North District, the second largest being [[Wong Wan Chau]]. The village of Tung O is located on its northwest coast.<ref>[http://ebook.lib.hku.hk/HKG/B35840158.pdf K.W. Lai, S.D.G. Campbell & R. Shaw, ''Geology of the Northeastern New Territories'', p. 15, Civil Engineering Dept, Geotechnical Engineering Office, December 1996]</ref> ==Conservation== Kat O is part of the [[Plover Cove (Extension) Country Park]] since 1979.<ref>[http://www.afcd.gov.hk/english/country/cou_vis/cou_vis_cou/cou_vis_cou_pc/cou_vis_cou_pc.html Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department: Plover Cove Country Park]</ref> Kat O Geoheritage Centre at No.142, Kat O Main Street, Kat O, was opened in 2010 by Kat O villagers, voluntary groups and the government to raise public awareness of geo-conservation, as part of the [[Hong Kong Geopark]].<ref>[http://www.geopark.gov.hk/en_geopark3g4.html Kat O Geoheritage Centre] Hong Kong Geopark</ref> ==See also== * [[Crooked Harbour]] * [[Double Haven]] * [[Pat Sin Leng Country Park]] * [[Islands of Hong Kong]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Kat O}} * [http://www.kut-o.com/ Kut-O Chinese Association (Kent area) Website] * [http://www.kut-o.com/archive.htm Pictures of Kat O] * [http://www.geopark.gov.hk/en_education2k.html Lee Yuk Ying Introduces the Cultural History of Kat O to Visitors] Hong Kong GeoPark. {{Islands of Hong Kong}} {{Coord|22|32|28|N|114|17|43.9|E|display=title|type:isle}} [[Category:Islands of Hong Kong]] [[Category:North District, Hong Kong]] [[Category:Hong Kong National Geopark]] {{HongKong-geo-stub}}
